p: The two samples collected in 2019 highlighted a chemical composition of essential oil typical of the two chemotypes already described in literature [ 12, 16], characterized by the prevalence of methyleugenol (41.5%), 1,8-cineole (39.7%) and limonene (7.6%) for the Campo di Giove one (CdG19-EO) and cis-pinocamphone (43.2%), methyleugenol (15.8%), trans-pinocamphone (11.0%) and 1,8-cineole (4.4%) for the other collected at Navelli (NAV19-EO).
